title: Big Tech was built by the same type of antitrust actions that could now tear it down
text: The fear in Silicon Valley is that antitrust investigations of big tech will blunt momentum of an industry that powers the U.S. economy. But history tells us another story.

title: Philip Green's Arcadia faces key vote as administration looms
text: Creditors will decide the fate of Philip Green's Arcadia group and its 18,000 workers at a vote on Wednesday on a sweetened restructuring plan to save the British fashion retailer.

title: Robots Will Manage Over $1 Trillion Soon
text: Digital wealth advisors are likely to see their growth explode five-fold by 2023.

title: Motorbike taxi firms rev up for race into West Africa
text: Motorcycle taxi companies are expanding in West Africa with backing from investors betting that the meteoric rise of two-wheeled taxi firms in Asia can be replicated in some of the fastest growing countries in the world.

title: Stocks Slip As Rally Pauses; Treasuries Advance: Markets Wrap
text: Stocks slipped globally on Wednesday alongside U.S. index futures amid signs the June revival in risk appetite may have overshot with trade concerns.

title: Mary Meeker’s 2019 Internet Trends report highlights China’s short-form videos and super apps
text: This year’s edition of Mary Meeker’s Internet Trends report, released earlier today, once again included a section on China prepared by Hillhouse Capital.

title: Bux raises additional $12.5M as it gears up to launch ‘zero-commission’ investing app
text: Bux, the Amsterdam-based trading app that wants to make investing fun, has picked up an additional $12.5 million in new funding. Venture capital firms Velocity Capital and Holtzbrinck Ventures led the round, which also includes debt financing from Kreos Capital.

title: China's CATL, Ant Financial and Hellobike set up e-bike battery firm
text: China's Contemporary Amperex Technology Co Ltd (CATL), Ant Financial Services and Hellobike said on Wednesday they will invest 1 billion yuan ($144.60 million) to establish a electric bicycle battery joint venture.

title: Norway fund may have to offload $1 billion stake in Glencore in shift away from coal
text: Norway's $1 trillion sovereign wealth fund may have to sell its $1 billion stake in commodities giant Glencore, among other companies that derive more than 30 percent of their revenue from coal, to meet proposed tighter ethical investing rules.

title: Adjust raises $227M to measure mobile ads and prevent fraud
text: Adjust is announcing that it has raised $227 million in new funding. The company, founded in Berlin back in 2012, has created a variety of ad measurement and anti-fraud tools — CEO Christian Henschel said the goal is to “make marketing simpler, smarter and safer.

title: Dow futures slightly lower as investors await inflation data
text: U.S. stock index futures were slightly lower Wednesday morning, as the White House took a tough line on trade talks with China.

title: BAT sees further growth in vaping, e-cigarette products this year
text: British American Tobacco, the world's No. 2 tobacco company, on Wednesday forecast sales of vaping and e-cigarette products to accelerate in the second half of the year and announced plans to consolidate the business into fewer brands.

title: Asia shares turn wary, U.S. inflation next hurdle
text: Asian share markets were in a defensive crouch on Wednesday as the White House took a tough line on trade talks with China, while a looming reading on U.S. inflation could scramble the odds for an early cut in interest rates there.

title: Iran scrambles to lift petrochemical sales as sanctions hammer oil
text: Iran has been racing to step up exports of petrochemicals and tap new markets to compensate for sliding oil sales, Iranian and international industry sources said, but now risks losing that crucial revenue as Washington tightens the screw on sanctions.

title: Stock buyers beware because a Fed rate cut might not work this time
text: While the Fed may cut, it's not a slam dunk that the dollar will fall.

title: The US-China Trade War Could Drag On For A Long Time
text: Trade negotiations with China could resume soon, in the flash of a tweet. But it will take a great deal of time to reach a deal, and much longer to seal it.

title: The US will maintain oil production despite falling prices, says deputy energy secretary
text: The U.S. will maintain its oil production — or even ramp it up higher — despite low energy prices, Deputy Energy Secretary Dan Brouillette said Wednesday.
